In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **C** serves the following purposes:

- c represents a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice_\(monster_class\) "Cockatrice (monster class)"):

  - c [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice")
  - c [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")
  - c [pyrolisk](/wiki/Pyrolisk "Pyrolisk")

* C represents a [centaur](/wiki/Centaur_\(monster_class\) "Centaur (monster class)"):

  - C [plains centaur](/wiki/Plains_centaur "Plains centaur")
  - C [forest centaur](/wiki/Forest_centaur "Forest centaur")
  - C [mountain centaur](/wiki/Mountain_centaur "Mountain centaur")

- Press [c]() to close a [door](/wiki/Door "Door").
- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [C]() to [call](/wiki/Call "Call") a monster, item or type of item by a particular name.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [2.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Historical uses

In hack121, a port of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [centaurs](/index.php?title=Centaur_\(monster\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur (monster) (page does not exist)") use the c glyph, while cockatrices use the C glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the C glyph is given to centaurs, and the b glyph is given to cockatrices. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). The cockatrice still uses c as its current glyph, while the centaur retains its C glyph up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the centaur monster is replaced with the centaur [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") and the three types of centaur. The cockatrice remains the only monster in its class until [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0"), which adds the chickatrice from [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10") and the pyrolisk from [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, the call command [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [C]() is used exclusively for naming monsters.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds three new monsters that use the c glyph:

- c cockatrice:

  - c [chicken](/wiki/Chicken "Chicken")
  - c [cockatoo](/wiki/Cockatoo "Cockatoo")
  - c [parrot](/wiki/Parrot "Parrot")

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [C]() allows the player to name items.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several new monsters that use the C glyph:

- C centaur:

  - C [sprow](/wiki/Sprow "Sprow")
  - C [centaur chieftain](/index.php?title=Centaur_chieftain\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur chieftain (page does not exist)")
  - C [drider](/wiki/Drider_\(dNetHack\) "Drider (dNetHack)")
  - C [priestess of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priestess_of_Ghaunadaur "Priestess of Ghaunadaur")
  - C [formian crusher](/index.php?title=Formian_crusher\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Formian crusher (page does not exist)")
  - C [formian taskmaster](/index.php?title=Formian_taskmaster\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Formian taskmaster (page does not exist)")
  - C [Synaisthesia](/index.php?title=Synaisthesia\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Synaisthesia (page does not exist)")
  - C [parasitized embraced alider](/index.php?title=Parasitized_embraced_alider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized embraced alider (page does not exist)")
  - C [Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion](/index.php?title=Blibdoolpoolp%27s_mindgraven_champion\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion (page does not exist)")
  - C [alider](/index.php?title=Alider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Alider (page does not exist)")
  - C [mendicant sprow](/index.php?title=Mendicant_sprow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mendicant sprow (page does not exist)")
  - C [mendicant drider](/index.php?title=Mendicant_drider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mendicant drider (page does not exist)")

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") retain the monsters added in dNetHack and adds two more monsters that use the C glyph:

- C centaur:

  - C [Berith](/wiki/Berith "Berith")
  - C [Miska](/index.php?title=Miska\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Miska (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds two new monsters that use the c and C glyphs:

- c cockatrice:
  - c [basilisk](/index.php?title=Basilisk_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Basilisk (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- C centaur:
  - C [centaur](/wiki/Centaur_\(EvilHack\) "Centaur (EvilHack)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM, and adds two monsters that use the C glyph:

- C [centaur shaman](/index.php?title=Centaur_shaman\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur shaman (page does not exist)")
- C [centaur prince](/index.php?title=Centaur_prince\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur prince (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

C

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the programming language, see ANSI C.
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter C serves the following purposes:

  • c represents a cockatrice:
    • c chickatrice
    • c cockatrice
    • c pyrolisk
  • C represents a centaur:
    • C plains centaur
    • C forest centaur
    • C mountain centaur
  • Press c to close a door.
  • Press shift + C to call a monster, item or type of item by a particular name.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 AceHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack
    • 2.4 notdNetHack
    • 2.5 EvilHack
    • 2.6 SlashTHEM

Historical uses

In hack121, a port of Jay Fenlason's Hack, centaurs use the c glyph, while cockatrices use the C glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and Hack 1.0, the C glyph is given to centaurs, and the b glyph is given to cockatrices. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in Hack 1.0. The cockatrice still uses c as its current glyph, while the centaur retains its C glyph up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the centaur monster is replaced with the centaur monster class and the three types of centaur. The cockatrice remains the only monster in its class until NetHack 3.3.0, which adds the chickatrice from NetHack-- 3.0.10 and the pyrolisk from SLASH 6.

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, the call command shift + C is used exclusively for naming monsters.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds three new monsters that use the c glyph:

  • c cockatrice:
    • c chicken
    • c cockatoo
    • c parrot

AceHack

In AceHack, shift + C allows the player to name items.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the C glyph:

  • C centaur:
    • C sprow
    • C centaur chieftain
    • C drider
    • C priestess of Ghaunadaur
    • C formian crusher
    • C formian taskmaster
    • C Synaisthesia
    • C parasitized embraced alider
    • C Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion
    • C alider
    • C mendicant sprow
    • C mendicant drider

notdNetHack

notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack retain the monsters added in dNetHack and adds two more monsters that use the C glyph:

  • C centaur:
    • C Berith
    • C Miska

EvilHack

EvilHack adds two new monsters that use the c and C glyphs:

  • c cockatrice:
    • c basilisk
  • C centaur:
    • C centaur

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM, and adds two monsters that use the C glyph:

  • C centaur shaman
  • C centaur prince

rawPage:
{{for|the programming language|ANSI C}}
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''C''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|c}} represents a [[Cockatrice (monster class)|cockatrice]]:
** {{monsymlink|chickatrice}}
** {{monsymlink|cockatrice}}
** {{monsymlink|pyrolisk}}

* {{white|C}} represents a [[Centaur (monster class)|centaur]]:
** {{monsymlink|plains centaur}}
** {{monsymlink|forest centaur}}
** {{monsymlink|mountain centaur}}

* Press {{kbd|c}} to close a [[door]].
* Press {{kbd|shift|C}} to [[call]] a monster, item or type of item by a particular name.

==Historical uses==
In hack121, a port of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], [[Centaur (monster)|centaurs]] use the {{white|c}} glyph, while cockatrices use the {{white|C}} glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and [[Hack 1.0]], the {{white|C}} glyph is given to centaurs, and the {{white|b}} glyph is given to cockatrices. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in [[Hack 1.0]]. The cockatrice still uses {{white|c}} as its current glyph, while the centaur retains its {{white|C}} glyph up to [[NetHack 2.3e]].

In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], the centaur monster is replaced with the centaur [[monster class]] and the three types of centaur. The cockatrice remains the only monster in its class until [[NetHack 3.3.0]], which adds the chickatrice from [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]] and the pyrolisk from [[SLASH 6]].

In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier versions, the call command {{kbd|shift|C}} is used exclusively for naming monsters.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds three new monsters that use the {{white|c}} glyph:

* {{white|c}} cockatrice:
** {{brown|c}} [[chicken]]
** {{white|c}} [[cockatoo]]
** {{green|c}} [[parrot]]

===AceHack===
In [[AceHack]], {{kbd|shift|C}} allows the player to name items.

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] adds several new monsters that use the {{white|C}} glyph:

* {{white|C}} centaur:
** {{black|C}} [[sprow]]
** {{magenta|C}} [[centaur chieftain]] 
** {{white|C}} [[Drider (dNetHack)|drider]]
** {{brightmagenta|C}} [[priestess of Ghaunadaur]] 
** {{blue|C}} [[formian crusher]]
** {{white|C}} [[formian taskmaster]]
** {{brightgreen|C}} [[Synaisthesia]]
** {{gray|C}} [[parasitized embraced alider]]
** {{magenta|C}} [[Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion]]
** {{white|C}} [[alider]]
** {{blue|C}} [[mendicant sprow]]
** {{blue|C}} [[mendicant drider]]

===notdNetHack===
[[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]] retain the monsters added in dNetHack and adds two more monsters that use the {{white|C}} glyph:

* {{white|C}} centaur:
** {{red|C}} [[Berith]]
** {{magenta|C}} [[Miska]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|c}} and {{white|C}} glyphs:

* {{white|c}} cockatrice:
** {{brightgreen|c}} [[Basilisk (EvilHack)|basilisk]]
* {{white|C}} centaur:
** {{red|C}} [[Centaur (EvilHack)|centaur]]

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM, and adds two monsters that use the {{white|C}} glyph:

* {{blue|C}} [[centaur shaman]]
* {{magenta|C}} [[centaur prince]]
{{nethack-367}}
